title: How to Send a ZIP File on Your Samsung Galaxy

steps.title: Open your Galaxy's My Files app.
steps.content: Open your Galaxy's My Files app. Find and tap the yellow folder icon on your Apps menu to open My Files.

steps.title: Tap and hold the file you want to compress.
steps.content: Tap and hold the file you want to compress. This will highlight the selected file. A yellow checkmark will appear. Optionally, you can select multiple files or a folder to compress. In this case, tap all the files or folders you want to select.

steps.title: Tap the ⋮ icon.
steps.content: Tap the ⋮ icon. This button is located in the upper-right corner of your screen. Tapping will open a drop-down menu with all your options.

steps.title: Tap Zip on the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Tap Zip on the drop-down menu. This will compress all the selected files and create a new Zip archive.

steps.title: Tap and hold the Zip file.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Zip file. This will highlight the Zip file on the list. A yellow checkmark will appear.

steps.title: Tap the orange SHARE button at the top.
steps.content: Tap the orange SHARE button at the top. You can find this option next to DELETE in the upper-right corner of your screen. This will allow you to select an app to share the selected Zip file.

steps.title: Select an app on the pop-up menu.
steps.content: Select an app on the pop-up menu. It will open your contacts menu in this app, and allow you to select a contact and send the Zip file.

steps.title: Tap the Send button.
steps.content: Tap the Send button. Depending on the app you choose, you will be able to share the Zip file with your contact in a chat conversation or an email.
